text: [Music]
throughout my life i've loved working
with children i've always had a passion
for it and i used to work in a nursery
and that um inspired me to then apply
for university to go on to this course
um which i'm really glad i have because
the amount of experience and subject
knowledge i've gained is really valuable
for my future career
[Music]
the last three years have been an
absolutely fantastic experience to me in
achieving my goal of becoming a primary
school teacher the staff here are
fantastic in making you feel welcome and
no problem is too small
primary education is the course for you
if you want to become a primary school
teacher it allows you to learn the craft
of being a teacher we teach all
curriculum areas so we teach english
maths science the foundation subjects
educational professional studies
and we have placements within schools so
a lot during the program you practice
becoming a teacher and at the end of it
you become a qualified teacher so it's
an ideal course for you if you know that
you want to be a primary teacher we
offer a postgraduate level and an
undergraduate level we also have
placements in schools so on a pgce you
do 120 days throughout the year on an
undergraduate course you do 120 days
over three years so you have placements
in three years so by the end of the
program you're a qualified teacher and
you're ready and able to go out and be
employed in a school
it's really amazing how quickly you move
on and from just being an adult in the
background of a setting to actually
taking the class and becoming the lead
teacher and it certainly set me up for
my nqt here next year and everything
i've learned in lectures and seminars
has just been a real insight into how i
can make myself a better teacher
greenwich has set up three really good
placements for me
placements where i felt supported
supported by both the university and the
school
it was actually my second year placement
that set up my third it was the head
teacher there that passed me on the
contacts for the third school and
luckily they were already in connection
with greenwich
i have quite a history with greenwich
university having been a student here
myself way back in 2004 when i took on
the pgce i remember within the first two
weeks going on a placement to a primary
school and being so inspired that i knew
absolutely that this was the right
course for me
i am now the head teacher at the school
where i had my very first placement so
greenwich is very special to me
i've had some really great experiences
with the school and they've all been
extremely diverse
and all three have been in very
different settings to allow me to build
my professionalism as much as possible
there are many advantages to studying at
greenwich one i would say is our
pastoral care we have an excellent
personal tutor system we know the
students really well we look after their
academic growth and their growth as
primary school teachers we have a wide
range of tutors who teach on both the ed
programs and the mo programmes we're all
experienced qualified primary teachers i
in fact started my nqt year 30 years ago
we offer excellent employability and
student satisfaction is very high and we
receive really good feedback from
students
my journey into teaching started here at
the university of greenwich when i
embarked on the three-year undergraduate
program i thoroughly enjoyed this
program and still have many friends that
i met here who are still teaching on my
third placement i really found that i
connected well with the school and was
offered to interview for the school and
was successful and taking up an
appointment and that was my first
teaching appointment which was brilliant
because i'd already built strong links
with the school for my third placement
now i'm not unique this happens to many
of our students that we work with and
could happen to you
all of the schools i've been headteacher
of have had a very strong partnership
arrangement with the university
we have a number of students both
undergraduate and postgraduates every
year and we support them in their
training and the first steps in their
teaching career
it's great for the school to have the
enthusiasm and the new ideas of the
students the partnership is very strong
and we benefit from having people in and
from that working rapport
i feel really excited and enthusiastic

and i really can't wait to get my own
